Description: When CF receives a "No-Op" command, CF shall increment the "CF Valid-Command Counter" and issue a cFE event message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): CF application is a cFS compliant component that must implement the cFS architectural patterns. The No-Op command allows operational checks on the end-to-end CF command and telemetry paths.

Description: When a "Reset-Counters" command is received, CF shall set the command-specified "housekeeping counters" to a value of zero.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): cFS architectural pattern for application operational interfaces. Allows for partial or full resetting of housekeeping counters. All reset operations should be observable.

Description: If a command's header-specified length is not equal to the expected command length, CF shall reject the command.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): For robust and secure operations, command must be validated prior to execution. Basic command verification in the event of SEU or memory corruption.

Description: When CF receives a valid command, CF shall increment the "CF Valid-Command Counter" and issue a "Command Received" cFE event message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Support an operational interface to provide operator feedback.

Description: When CF receives a command, if the command is not valid, CF shall reject the command.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): For robust and secure operations, invalid commands must be rejected and not executed.

Description: When CF receives a command, CF shall check that the command is valid before execution.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): For robust and secure operations, commands and their parameters must be validated prior to execution

Description: When CF rejects a command, CF shall issue a "Command Rejected" error event message and increment the "CF Command Rejected" Counter.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Provide operator feedback; operators need to be made aware of command rejection both in real-time through cFS event messages and through HouseKeeping telemetry through counters.

Description: When CF receives a CFDP receive-file protocol-directive PDU, CF shall process the file transfer request according to the directive-specified CFDP Mode, "Unacknowledged" Class-1 Service or "Acknowledged" Class-2 Service.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Basic file transfer function that specifies the CFDP classes that shall be implemented.

Description: CF shall extract uplinked CFDP PDUs from cFE-SB messages.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): CF application is a cFS compliant component that must implement the cFS architectural patterns

Description: CF shall extract file data from File-Data PDUs and reconstruct an identical copy of the extracted file from the meta-data-specified directory.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Basic CFDP function with fault handling defined in sub requirements

Description: If CF detects that a "fault" has occurred, CF shall close out the transaction and issue an "Error" cFE event message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): For robust and secure operations, errors in execution must be detected and handled with appropriate constraints on resource use and state machine iterations.  "Close out" is intentionally vague since the action needs to be appropriate for the transmission class.  As long as the transaction doesn't hang and become stale the requirement is met.  Note "cancel" is overly specific, there's a cancel transaction command that is different than what is done here.

Description:
CF shall detect the following scenarios and identify them as faults:
1. Positive Ack Limit Reached
2. Filestore Rejection
3. File-CRC Mismatch Failure
4. File-Size Error
5. NAK Limit Reached
6. Inactivity Limit Reached
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Fault scenarios explicitly listed and tested for specification compliance.

Description: CF shall issue issue a DEBUG message if an attempt is made to reset a transaction that has already been freed

When CF receives a "Transfer File" command, CF shall play back the file indicated by the command-specified: filename, source path, destination path, keep/delete flag, service class, priority, channel, and peer-entity id.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Also referred to as "playback file" command. Basic function of file transfer required to operate cFS flight systems.

Description: When CF receives a "Transfer File" command, if the command-specified is open, CF reject the command.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Open files are in a uncertain state and may change during transfer potential containing erroneous data or cause other undefined behaviors

Description: When CF receives a "Transfer File" command, if the command-specified file is not found, CF shall reject the command.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): For robust and secure operations, command must be validated prior to execution. Provides operational interface as to why the command was not executed.

Description: When CF receives a "Transfer File" command, if the playback-pending queue is full, CF shall reject the command.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): For robust and secure operations, command must be validated prior to execution. Provides operational interface as to why the command was not executed. Filterable is required to avoid multiple events when commands are sequenced.

Description: When CF receives a "Transfer File" command, if the command-specified playback-channel number is not valid, CF shall reject the command.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): For robust and secure operations, command must be validated prior to execution

Description: When CF receives a "Transfer File" command, if the command-specified CFDP class is neither Class 1 nor Class 2, CF shall reject the command.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): CF App only supports Class 1 and Class 2 CFDP requests

Description: When CF receives a "Playback Directory" command, CF shall play back all the files inside the command-specified directory as indicated by the command-specified service class, priority, destination path, keep/delete flag, channel, and peer-entity id.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Operational interface to support automation of file transfer. Interface excludes subdirectories to reduce complexity of implementation. Note the

Description: While CF is playing back multiple files, if the next file to be transferred is open, CF shall skip its transfer and issue an error event message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Open files are in a uncertain state and may change during transfer potential containing erroneous data.  Note this requirement is different than CF3000.1 in that this is determined at time of playback not at command receipt.

Description: When CF receives a "Playback Directory" command, if the command-specified directory is not found, CF shall reject the command.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): For robust and secure operations, command must be validated prior to execution. Provides operational interface as to why the command was not executed.

Description: When CF receives a "Playback Directory" command, if the playback-pending queue is full, CF shall reject the command.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): For robust and secure operations, constraints on resource violations must be checked and reported.

Description: When CF receives a "Playback Directory" command, if the command-specified playback channel number is not valid, CF shall reject the command.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Support an operational interface to provide operator feedback when commands are malformed.

Description: When CF receives a "Playback Directory" command, if the command-specified class number is not valid, CF shall reject the command.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Basic requirement to check parameters for reliable and secure operations.

Description: CF shall encapsulate and publish CFDP-PDUs as cFE-SB messages.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): CF application is a cFS compliant component that must implement the cFS architectural patterns. Each channel's MID should be unique to that channel. The intent is to allow different communication interfaces to subscribe to a selected channel and manage it independently

Description: Each CF channel shall have a unique cFE-SB Message ID.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Playback channels may have different message routes to destination. In cFS, the Message ID provides that routing identifier. Unique cFE-SB Message IDs can avoid data corruption and memory problems.

Description: The CF-channel cFE-SB Message IDs shall be specified in a CF configuration table.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Run-time configuration table supports ease of deployment, operation maintenance, fault management, and data path configuration.

Description: The PDU output rate shall be controllable from outside the CF Application.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): As a data source in a real-time resourced constrained system, CF must not send more data than the receiver can reliably process or forward

Description: While there are multiple transactions in the playback-pending queue for a given channel, CF shall wait for the "EOF Sent" marker on the file currently being played back before starting playback for the next file in the queue.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale):
Provides predictable file-in-order delivery. This does not imply that the "EOF Sent" has been acknowledged by the receiving peer entity.

Although CCSDS 3.1.2 says "The CFDP entity shall be implemented such that virtually any number of transactions may be concurrently in various stages of transmission or reception at a single CFDP entity." this number must be constrained for performance.

Description: While there is no playback in progress, CF shall check the playback-pending channel queue for files at the configuration-table-defied frequency.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Supports automation of playback queuing

Description: The CF channel playback-pending-queue depth shall be configurable.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Supports recovery of file transfer operations to a known configuration and state

Description: The CF file-transfer history-queue depth shall be configurable.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Operational interface to support user knowledge of which files have been transferred and in what order.

Description: The number of CF channels shall be defined by a CF configuration table.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Table-defined configurations support cFS architecture goals of scalability and reconfiguration of mission variability points

Description: CF-channel parameters shall be defined by a CF configuration table.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Table-defined configurations support cFS architecture goals of scalability and reconfiguration of mission variability points

Description:
The "CF Configuration Table" shall include the following parameters:
-- Engine parameter(s)
1. Local entity ID
-- Channel parameters (per-channel)
2. Dequeue Enable 
3. Transmit PDU MID
4. Receive PDU MID
5. Handshake Semaphore Name
6. Acknowledge timer limit
7. Non-acknowledge timer limit
8. Acknowledge retry limit
9. Non-acknowledge retry limit
10. Inactivity timer limit
-- Polling Directory Parameters (per-polling directory)
11. Enable State
12. CFDP Class
13. Priority
14. Source Path
15. Destination Path
16. Peer Entity Id
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Engine, channel, and polling directory configuration parameters for operational flexibility.

Description: Each CF channel shall have a dedicated and independent pending queue.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale):
Playback channels should be independent to avoid one channels from stalling another channel.

The channel dictates the SB MsgId / Apid that the playback data PDUs will be generated with. Separate queues also helps when the one channel is throttled - e.g. if there are two channels and one is slow and one is faster, a playback requests to the slow channel may block the faster channel if they shared a single pending queue.

Description: When CF receives an "Enable Polling" command, CF shall enable poll-directory processing.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Operational interface

Description: CF Polling Directories shall be polled for files at the configuration-table-defined frequency.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Operational interface to support optimization of resource utilization and file transfer bandwidth

Description: CF shall send all files in the polling directory at the configuration-table-specified priority level.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Operational interface for resource management

Description: When CF receives a "Disable Polling" command, CF shall disable poll-directory processing.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Operational Interface

Description: When CF receives a "Freeze Channel" command, CF shall disable the command-specified channel.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Operational interface that halts all transactions at their current state. (timers, suspend, etc.) Typically used for contact scheduling

Description: When CF receives a "Freeze Channel" command, CF shall pause all in-progress transactions for the command-specified channel.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Ensure command is applied immediately

Description: While a channel is frozen, when a new transaction is received for that channel, CF shall not process that transaction.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): A frozen channel cannot receive new transactions

Description: When CF receives a "Thaw Channel" command, CF shall re-enable the command-specified channel.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Operational Interface

Description: When CF receives a "Thaw Channel" command, CF shall resume processing all paused transactions for the command-specified channel.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Operational interface that resumes all transactions at their current state. (timers, suspend,…) Typical used for contact scheduling

Description:
The following parameters shall be configurable by a CF command:
1. CFDP channel Ack-Timer Value (seconds)
2. CFDP channel NAK-Timer Value (seconds)  
3. CFDP channel Inactivity-Timeout Value (seconds) 
4. CFDP channel Maximum Ack Timeouts (integer counts)
5. CFDP channel Maximum NAK Timeouts (integer counts)
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Operational interface to support mission variability and reconfiguration

Description:
The default values for the CFDP channel protocol parameters below shall be defined by a CF Configuration Table:
1. CFDP channel Ack-Timer Value (seconds)
2. CFDP channel NAK-Timer Value (seconds)  
3. CFDP channel Inactivity-Timeout Value (seconds) 
4. CFDP channel Maximum Ack Timeouts (integer counts)
5. CFDP channel Maximum NAK Timeouts (integer counts)
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Ensure CF starts in a known and valid operational state

Description: When CF receives a "Set CFDP Channel Protocol Configuration" command, CF shall set the command-specified parameter to the command-specified value and issue a cFE event message that confirms the change.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Operational Interface

Description: When CF receives a "Set CFDP Channel Protocol Configuration" command,  if the command-specified parameter is invalid, CF shall reject the command.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Command validity check for robust operation

Description: When CF receives a "Set CFDP Channel Protocol Configuration" command,  if the command-specified parameter *value* is invalid, CF shall reject the command.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Command validity check for robust operation

Description: When CF receives a "Get CFDP Channel-Protocol Configuration Parameter" command, CF shall issue an event message containing the current value of the command-specified configuration-table parameter.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Operational interface

Description: When CF receives a "Get CFDP Channel-Protocol Configuration Parameter" command, if the command-specified parameter is invalid, CF shall reject the command.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Operational robustness

Description: When CF receives a "Get Full CFDP Channel-Protocol Configuration" command, CF shall publish all CFDP Channel Protocol Configuration parameters to a cFS-SB message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Compatibility with cFE App behavior. Message can be downlinked as Housekeeping Data or sent to another app for consumption

Description: When CF receives a "Cancel Transaction" command, CF shall cancel the transaction indicated by the command-specified Entity ID and transaction-sequence number.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Support an operational interface to control transactions. Transaction-Id provides a mechanism to scale to large systems and avoid performance issues with string searches

Description: When CF receives a "Cancel Transaction" command, if the command-specified transaction is not in progress, CF shall reject the command.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Support an operational interface to provide operator feedback.

Description: When CF receives an "Abandon Transaction" command, CF shall abandon the command-specified transaction.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Support an operational interface to provide operator feedback.

Description: When CF receives an "Abandon Transaction" command, if the command-specified transaction is not in progress, CF shall reject the command.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Support an operational interface to provide operator feedback.

Description: When CF receives an "Abandon All Transactions" command, CF shall abandon all transactions.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Operational interface that removes transaction state for all active transaction.

Description: When CF receives an "Abandon All Transactions" command, if there are no transactions in progress, CF shall reject the command.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Support an operational interface to provide operator feedback.

Description: When CF receives a "Write Active Transactions" command, CF shall write all active transactions to a file.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Operational interface supporting operator insight into transfer sequence and state

Description: The CF maximum-uplink PDU size shall be defined and configured at compile time.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Support constraints for security checks and resource utilization.

Description: The CF maximum number of simultaneous per-channel transactions shall be defined and configured at compile time.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Channel concept extended to allow independent operations when other channels may be blocked due to maximum transactions

Description: The CF maximum per-channel downlink-PDU size shall be defined and configured at compile time.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Support constraints for security checks and resource utilization. Allows the PDU size to be optimized for the channel communications stack (MTU for transport and data link)

Description: When CF receives a "Cancel All Transactions" command, CF shall cancel all in-progress transactions.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Support an operational interface to control transactions.  "All" provides an interface to cancel transactions without having knowledge of each individual transaction number. Especially useful when there may be hundreds or thousands of transactions in progress.

Description: When CF receives "Cancel *All* Transactions" command, if there are no transactions in progress, CF shall reject the command.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Support an operational interface to provide operator feedback.

Description: When CF receives a "Suspend Transaction" command, if the command-specified transaction is not in progress, CF shall reject the command.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Support an operational interface to provide operator feedback.

Description: When CF receives a "Suspend Transaction" command, if the command-specified transaction is not in progress, CF shall reject the command.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Support an operational interface to provide operator feedback.

Description: When CF receives a "Suspend All Transactions" command, CF shall suspend all in-progress transactions.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Operational interface to align file transfer with communications contact schedule.

Description: When CF receives a "Suspend All Transactions" command, if no transactions are in progress, CF shall reject the command.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Support an operational interface to provide operator feedback.

Description: When CF receives a "Resume Transaction" command, CF shall resume the command-specified suspended transaction
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Operational interface to resume normal operations without knowing which files are suspended

Description: When CF receives a "Resume Transaction" command, if the command-specified transaction is not suspended, CF shall reject the command.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Operational interface

Description: When CF receives a "Resume *All* Transactions", CF shall resume all suspended transactions
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Operational interface to resume normal operations without knowing which files are suspended

Description: When CF receives a "Resume ALL Transactions", if there are no suspended transactions, CF shall reject the command.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Ensure robust operations and provide operator feedback.

Description: When CF receives a "Purge Queue" command, CF shall purge the command-specified queue for the command-specified output channel.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Support an operational interface to provide operator feedback.

Description: When CF receives a "Purge Queue" command, if the command-specified queue is not defined, CF shall reject the command.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Ensure robust operations and provide operator feedback.

Description: When CF receives a "Purge Queue" command, if the command-specified channel is not defined, CF shall reject the command.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Ensure robust operations and provide operator feedback.

Description: When CF receives a "Write Queue" command, CF shall write the command-specified queue's contents to the command-specified file.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Operational interface to allow insight into file transfer order.

Description: When CF receives a "Write Queue" command, if the command-specified queue is not defined, CF shall reject the command.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Ensure robust operations and provide operator feedback.

Description: When CF receives a "De-Queue File" command, CF shall remove the command-specified file from its current queue.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Support an operational interface to provide operator feedback.

Description: When CF receives a "De-Queue File" command, if the command-specified file is not found, CF shall reject the command.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Ensure robust operations and provide operator feedback.

Description: The maximum number of transmissions, that is, the sum of simultaneous transmit and receive transactions, shall be defined at compile time.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Supports scaling resource use for mission variability

Description: When CF receives a file-transfer request, if the requested file's size is larger than 2^32 bytes, CF shall reject the request and issue an error event message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Constrain resources use and exclude implementation complexity of CCSDS  Large-file-size header extensions. CFDP-1S-01

Description: When CF receives a PDU, if the size of the Entity ID fields are too large for the configured internal storage, CF shall reject the PDU and issue an error event message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Prevent silent truncation of variable length Entity ID fields in PDU by checking the configured storage size and rejecting PDUs that with an Entity ID field that would be truncated.

Description: When CF receives a PDU, if the size of the Transaction Sequence Number field is too large for the configured internal storage, CF shall reject the PDU and issue an error event message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Prevent silent truncation of variable length Transaction Sequence Number field in PDU by checking configured storage size and rejecting PDUs that with a Transaction Sequence Number field that would be truncated.

Description: Each CF output channel shall have 256 file-transfer priority levels.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Priority levels are used to control the order of file transfer PDUs within a channel. Priority levels allow the control of PDU interleaving in a output channel and prevent a lower-priority transfer from blocking a high-priority operational transfer. 256 priority levels provide a high-level of granularity in the compact space of 1 byte.

Description: The CF file transmission priority level for each polling directory shall be configurable.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Supports management of priorities for each polling directory.  Commanded transfers (single file or playback directory) use the priority level contained in the command.

Description: The highest file-transfer priority level shall be zero.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Standardized interface. If the number of levels increases or decreases the highest priority will always be the same

Description: CF shall send NAK re-transmissions in the order received at the same priority as the NAK-targeted file
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): PDU re-transmission priority should be the same as the original request. To not do so would allow a form of priority inversion where a large number of NAKs on a lower priority transfer would suppress re-transmission of higher priority transfers.

Description: CF shall support CFDP file transfers in "Unacknowledged"(Class-1) Service Mode.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Basic file transfer function. Unacknowledged Mode, also called unreliable mode, is used for non-critical data or operations without bi-directional data paths.

Description: CF shall support CFDP file transfer in "Acknowledged" (Class-2) Service, Mode.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Basic file transfer function. Acknowledged Mode, also called reliable mode, is used for critical data and/or operations with bi-directional data paths.

Description:
The CF Housekeeping message shall include
1. Command Counter
2. Command Error Counter
-- Per-Channel HouseKeeping Entries
4. Number of transactions on the various queues
5. Frozen Status
6. Number of Valid PDUs Received
7. Number of Receive-Transaction Errors
8. Number of Sent PDUs 
9. Number of Acknowledge Retry Limit Exceeded Faults
10. Number of Non-Acknowledge Retry Limit Exceeded Faults
11. Number of Inactivity Timer-Limit Faults
12. Number of CRC Mismatch Faults
13. Number of Filestore Rejection Faults (can be split by type)
14. Number of Filesize Mismatch Faults
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Operator interface that provides detailed status on operational state

Description:
The CF End of Transaction message shall include
1. Transaction identifier
2. Channel number
3. Direction of transaction
4. Filenames associated with transaction
5. Transaction state
6. Condition code
7. Source EID of transaction
8. Peer EID of transaction
9. File size
10. CRC state
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Operator interface that provides detailed information on transaction

Description: When a transaction terminates, CF shall generate an End of Transaction information packet
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Operational awareness of transaction closure and potential automation of follow-on actions

Description: If a transaction has reached the FIN or EOF state, the CF End of Transaction message Condition Code shall be set to the CFDP condition code for that transaction.
If the transaction has not reached the FIN or EOF state, the CF End of Transaction message Condition Code shall indicate why the transaction stopped early.
When CF is initialized, CF shall initialize the the housekeeping counters/numbers to zero and the frozen status as "thawed".
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): All variable must be set to a known valid state on initialization to support reliable functioning

Description: When CF is initialized, CF shall load valid CF Configuration Tables.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): All variables must be set to a known valid state on initialization to support reliable functioning. Table interface supports operational reconfiguration of CF functions.

Description: If a CF Configuration Table fails validation, CF shall issue an error cFE event message and exit.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Support constraints for security checks and resource utilization. Without a valid configuration CF can not initialize to a functional state.

Description: CF shall validate CF configuration table parameters.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Support constraints for security checks and resource utilization. Without a valid configuration CF can not initialize to a functional state.  Specific content validation is implementation defined.

Description: When CF receives an "Initialize Engine" command, CF shall enable the CFDP engine and re-load its configuration.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Supports operator interface to disable operations due to misconfiguration and other faults

Description: When CF receives a "Disable Engine" command, CF shall disable the CFDP engine and reset its state.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Supports operator interface to disable operations due to misconfiguration and other faults
